title: The case of the waggoneers and carriers of goods and merchandizes, through the several roads of England. Humbly submitted to the honourable House of Commons assembled in Parliament
notes: Complains of the ill-effects of "An additional Act for the better repairing of high-ways.." (22 Car.2.c.12), namely, extortion and racketeering by organised gangs of informers, such as that of John Little-Hales of Edmonton, and Richard Fielder of Piccadilly.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
